meanings.definition: Secret or illegal cooperation or conspiracy, especially in order to cheat or deceive others.
meanings.sent1: The collusion between the two companies led to unfair prices for customers.
meanings.sent2: The politicians were accused of collusion in the corruption scandal.
meanings.sent3: The cats seemed to be in collusion to steal the fish from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The collusion of shadows made the alley look darker than usual.
meanings.sent5: The collusion of colors in the painting created a beautiful harmony.

meanings.definition: A secret agreement or cooperation for an illegal or deceitful purpose.
meanings.sent1: The collusion between the students to cheat on the exam was discovered by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The criminals were engaged in collusion to commit the robbery.
meanings.sent3: The collusion of squirrels to steal nuts from the garden was quite sneaky.
meanings.sent4: The collusion of waves against the shore created a mesmerizing sound.
meanings.sent5: The collusion of flavors in the dish made it taste exquisite.
